metadata.title: Landing Page Polish Pass (Responsive, Accessibility, Conversion UX, Performance Hygiene)
metadata.prd_reference: 5 Frontend Design Guidelines + user Healio UI pillars + launch readiness UX expectations

context.background: This task performs the final polish pass on the new Healio landing page after implementation. It focuses on conversion UX quality, accessibility, responsive behavior, content clarity, and browser-verified presentation quality using Chrome DevTools MCP.

design_constraints.constraint: Preserve the marketing redesign while improving polish; do not regress message clarity or section hierarchy.
Prioritize mobile readability, CTA visibility, spacing consistency, and trust-building presentation quality.
Accessibility polish should include keyboard flow, focus visibility, heading/landmark clarity, button/link labels, and reduced-motion compatibility where applicable.
Validation must use Chrome DevTools MCP and follow the shared frontend verification rules.

instruction.step: Audit the newly implemented landing page for spacing rhythm, typography consistency, CTA prominence, trust signal placement, and section transitions on desktop and mobile.
Fix responsive issues (overflow, cramped content, awkward card stacks, poor CTA placement) and accessibility issues (focus, labels, landmark clarity, semantic structure) found during verification.
Review console/network output for avoidable errors and remove any leftover developer/demo artifacts from the homepage experience.
Perform a full Chrome DevTools MCP verification pass (desktop + mobile) and record snapshots plus interaction evidence (navigation/CTA/button behavior).
Run `npm run typecheck` after polish changes.

validation_checklist.check: Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify desktop/mobile layout, interactions, console output, and capture final validation snapshots.
Run `npm run typecheck` for the final landing page polish changes.
Confirm CTA hierarchy is clear and visible above the fold on desktop and mobile.
Confirm the page clearly communicates trust, multi-tenant SaaS positioning, and role-based workflow value without generic filler copy.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The landing page is visually polished and conversion-ready across desktop and mobile breakpoints.
Accessibility and interaction quality are improved and verified (focus/keyboard/semantic clarity) without regressions.
Console/runtime issues on the landing page are either resolved or explicitly documented as expected in evidence.
Chrome DevTools MCP evidence is recorded and the task is not marked complete without it.

output_spec.commit_message: refactor(healio-marketing): polish landing page accessibility and conversion ux

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, typecheck command, Chrome DevTools MCP snapshots/notes, and commit references here.
Include Chrome DevTools MCP evidence (desktop + mobile snapshots, interaction checks, console review) before marking frontend tasks complete.

execution_tracking.completion_signal: Task is done only when state=DONE, is_done=true, completed_at is filled, verification_status=PASSED, and evidence records changed files/tests/snapshots as applicable.

references.verification_tool: Chrome DevTools MCP (required for frontend task verification)
